workshops.title: Web3 Security Deep Dive
workshops.description: Master the art of securing blockchain applications and smart contracts.
workshops.fullDescription: Dive deep into Web3 security with hands-on training on smart contract vulnerabilities, blockchain forensics, and DeFi security. Learn to identify common exploits like reentrancy attacks, flash loan vulnerabilities, and front-running. This workshop includes live demonstrations of real-world hacks and defensive coding practices. Participants will audit actual smart contracts and learn to use tools like Slither, Mythril, and Hardhat for security testing.
learningOutcomes: Identify and exploit common smart contract vulnerabilities
Perform security audits using industry-standard tools
Implement secure coding practices for Web3

speakers.name: Dr. Sarah Chen
speakers.bio: Blockchain Security Researcher with 5+ years in DeFi security

workshops.title: Advanced Penetration Testing Workshop
workshops.description: Learn advanced penetration testing techniques from industry experts.
workshops.fullDescription: An intensive hands-on workshop covering advanced penetration testing methodologies used by professional red teamers. Topics include network pivoting, privilege escalation, Active Directory exploitation, evasion techniques, and post-exploitation strategies. Participants will work through realistic enterprise scenarios, learning to chain vulnerabilities and maintain persistence. The workshop includes access to a live lab environment with multiple attack surfaces to explore.
prerequisites: Basic knowledge of Linux command line
Familiarity with Kali Linux or similar pentesting distro
learningOutcomes: Execute multi-stage attacks on enterprise networks
Bypass modern EDR and antivirus solutions
Document findings in professional pentest reports

speakers.name: Marcus Rodriguez

workshops.title: AI-Powered Threat Hunting
workshops.description: Harness artificial intelligence for next-generation threat detection and response.
workshops.fullDescription: Explore the intersection of AI and cybersecurity in this cutting-edge workshop. Learn to build machine learning models for anomaly detection, use AI-powered SIEM tools, and leverage LLMs for security analysis. The workshop covers behavioral analytics, automated threat hunting, and AI-assisted incident response. Participants will work with real security datasets, training models to detect APTs, insider threats, and zero-day attacks. Includes hands-on sessions with popular tools like Splunk ML Toolkit, Elastic SIEM, and custom Python-based detection scripts.
prerequisites: Familiarity with log analysis (optional but helpful)
learningOutcomes: Build ML models for threat detection
Implement behavioral analytics for insider threat detection
Analyze security data using LLMs and NLP techniques

speakers.name: Dr. Emily Watson
speakers.bio: AI Security Researcher and former DARPA scientist
